Â  Â  Â  Â  }

Â  Â  }

  1. Write a program to find mean of the array elements. Then find the count and the elements which are lesser, greater, and equal to the mean

#include <iostream>

using namespace std;

int main()

{

Â  Â  int n, mean = 0, gtm = 0, ltm = 0, etm = 0;

Â  Â  cout << "Enter the number of elements in the array ";

Â  Â  cin >> n;

Â  Â  int arr[n];

Â  Â  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)

Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << "Enter element at position [" << i + 1 << "] ";

Â  Â  Â  Â  cin >> arr[i];

Â  Â  Â  Â  mean += arr[i];

Â  Â  }

Â  Â  mean = mean / n;

Â  Â  cout << "The mean of the elements in the array is: " << mean << endl;

Â  Â  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)

Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  if (arr[i] > mean)

Â  Â  Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  gtm++;

Â  Â  Â  Â  }

Â  Â  Â  Â  else if (arr[i] < mean)

Â  Â  Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ltm++;

Â  Â  Â  Â  }

Â  Â  Â  Â  else

Â  Â  Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  etm++;

Â  Â  Â  Â  }

Â  Â  }

Â  Â  cout << "Number of elements that are less than mean: " << ltm << endl;

Â  Â  cout << "Elements that are less than mean:" << endl;

Â  Â  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)

Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  if (arr[i] < mean)

Â  Â  Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << arr[i] << " ";

Â  Â  Â  Â  }

Â  Â  }

Â  Â  cout << endl;

Â  Â  cout << "Number of elements that are greater than mean: " << gtm << endl;

Â  Â  cout << "Greater than mean:" << endl;

Â  Â  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)

Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  if (arr[i] > mean)

Â  Â  Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << arr[i] << " ";

Â  Â  Â  Â  }

Â  Â  }

Â  Â  cout << endl;

Â  Â  cout << "Number of elements that are equal to mean: " << etm << endl;

Â  Â  cout << "Equal to mean:" << endl;

Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  if (arr[i] == mean)

Â  Â  Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << arr[i] << " ";

Â  Â  Â  Â  }

Â  Â  }

  1. Write a program to find count of even and odd elements from an array

#include <iostream>

using namespace std;

int main()

{

Â  Â  int n, even = 0, odd = 0;

Â  Â  cout << "Enter the number of elements in the array ";

Â  Â  cin >> n;

Â  Â  int arr[n];

Â  Â  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)

Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << "Enter element at position [" << i + 1 << "] ";

Â  Â  Â  Â  cin >> arr[i];

Â  Â  }

Â  Â  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)

Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  if (arr[i] % 2 == 0)

Â  Â  Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  even++;

Â  Â  Â  Â  }

Â  Â  Â  Â  else

Â  Â  Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  odd++;

Â  Â  Â  Â  }

Â  Â  }

Â  Â  cout << "The number of even elements in the array is " << even << endl;

Â  Â  cout << "The number of odd elements in the array is " << odd << endl;
